callum rhys tilbury
education experience projects blog

Hey, I'm Callum! I hope you are well.

Thanks so much for checking out my personal website. The other tabs on this site have explored some of the formal depictions of who I am—what I studied, where I have worked, the exciting projects I have completed, and my creative portfolio.

Though these aspects of my life are important, they do not constitute everything that 'Callum Tilbury' is. Of course, sharing absolutely everything with the internet is not a great idea, and I don't plan to do that. Nevertheless, it's nice to share some of the informal aspects of who I am. Hopefully, in doing this, I can give you, O Surfer of the Internet, a small glimpse into my life.

music

It feels somewhat generic to say that "I love music" when describing myself, as this is a trait shared by many people. I think music is incredible, though, and it can evoke an incredibly wide array of emotions. I listen to a lot of music, and I love diving into diverse genres, with a home probably in 'Alternative'. I make playlists every season (though the playlist's content has no distinctly seasonal qualities), and I've shared my latest one here.

I love finding new music, so if you want to suggest something to me, click here!




podcasts

Over the past year or so, I have started to listen to podcasts regularly, which has been really interesting. I am probably a bit late to the party, but there is so much good content out there! In particular, I gravitate towards podcasts about technology, public policy, social democracy, and entrepreneurship. I have linked here some of the shows I have recently been enjoying.

I am always keen to try out new shows, so if you want to suggest something to me, click here!



books

So many books, so little time!

I often feel overwhelmed by how many books I want to read, because there is just so much out there—so much knowledge waiting to be absorbed. Of course, the best way to overcome this angst is simply to stop worrying, and just sit down to read.

Lately I have been trying to dig into some classical fiction, but I also enjoy modern non-fiction, usually in the broad categories of popular science and psychology. Having said that, this isn't a hard rule! My five most recent reads are given here.

My to-read list is ridiculously long, but you're welcome to make it longer! If you want to suggest a book to me, click here.



running

It all started with a Parkrun.

I think my fitness story is shared by many others: I always wanted to get into running, but I never committed—I felt like I didn't have the time or energy. That is, until I started attending my local Parkrun—where I was met with a warm community and a weekly commitment. After that, I fell in love!

I have certainly gone through seasons in my running—periods of ease, and periods of absolute slog. I think this is normal, and it often reflects how other aspects of my life are going. Nevertheless, running is an incredible activity for both my mind and body, and I am so grateful to have the ability to partake in it.

Since I am currently in a slog-ish phase, I've shown here a run from a while back: my 21km personal best, from a time where I was feeling great. I know I'll get back there eventually!
